intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. wallrothianum, commonly known as the Wallroth's hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in grassy habitats. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bracted flowers in a single inflorescence. This subspecies is typically perennial and grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters.
